page.title: 02LAUGHTON TRADITIONS
page.content: Laughton has several traditions. Here are some of them. {Stoolball}is a traditional game in Laughton and throughout Sussex. In stoolball you have two white poles in the ground with square boards on top. The bowler bowls six times from the middle of the posts; stoolball is very like cricket in some ways. The{School Fete,}with games and stalls, is held every year. My favourite games are Pick-a-pot, the Lemonade Wheel and the Coconut Shy. Each year a different person opens the fete. {Maypole dancing}is held in both Laughton and Ripe. Both villages have a queen: there are four attendants and sixteen dancers. The proceeds from the{Village Fete}are shared between the Village Hall and the Church.
